result.execSummary:
The defendant Cetharion L Chrisco was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin(>3-10g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. Consec to 14CF244.
4/1/16 Crt orders JOC corrected to reflect that the def is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. All other conditions remain the same.

superMiscConds.notes: $268 to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  $250 DNA surcharge remitted.

Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.
